result.execSummary:
The defendant Dawn R Davison was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Racine County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: Statutory costs assessed.   If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

No alcohol or controlled substances except by prescription. Random UA's are authorized. Any counseling deemed appropriate by agent. Must continue in any counseling per CHIPS order. No contact with Altherelle Robbins. No firearms may be in the home. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law. Firearm warning given. Voting is prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations while on supervision.

timeConds.notes:
Must serve 30 days. Huber is granted for employment. Do not report late or under the influence of alcohol or controlled substances except by prescription. Absolute sobriety is required. The balance is stayed.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  ***TO BE CO-SIGNED BY: DISTARCHA DAVISON, D.O.B. 9-8-82*** It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any alcohol or controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance. Defendant must attend 3 self-help meetings per week and provide signed proof of attendance to her sister at Genesis Behavioral Services. Defendant ordered not to possess or control any weapons.  Defendant is not to have any children in her custody unless HSD approves.   No contact with the co-defendant.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.  Defendant must attend 3 self-help meetings per week and provide signed proof of attendance.
